1.verse: From Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and from Timothy, our brother. To Philemon, our dear friend and worker with us;

2.verse: to Apphia, our sister; to Archippus, a worker with us; and to the church that meets in your home:

3.verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear about the love you have for all God’s holy people and the faith you have in the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: I pray that the faith you share may make you understand every blessing we have in Christ.

7.verse: I have great joy and comfort, my brother, because the love you have shown to God’s people has refreshed them.

8.verse: Accept Onesimus as a Brother - So, in Christ, I could be bold and order you to do what is right.

9.verse: But because I love you, I am pleading with you instead. I, Paul, an old man now and also a prisoner for Christ Jesus,

10.verse: am pleading with you for my child Onesimus, who became my child while I was in prison.

11.verse: In the past he was useless to you, but now he has become useful for both you and me.

12.verse: I am sending him back to you, and with him I am sending my own heart.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me so that in your place he might help me while I am in prison for the Good News.

14.verse: But I did not want to do anything without asking you first so that any good you do for me will be because you want to do it, not because I forced you.

15.verse: Maybe Onesimus was separated from you for a short time so you could have him back forever—

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a loved brother. I love him very much, but you will love him even more, both as a person and as a believer in the Lord.

17.verse: So if you consider me your partner, welcome Onesimus as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he has done anything wrong to you or if he owes you anything, charge that to me.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand. I will pay it back, and I will say nothing about what you owe me for your own life.

20.verse: So, my brother, I ask that you do this for me in the Lord: Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: I write this letter, knowing that you will do what I ask you and even more.

22.verse: One more thing—prepare a room for me in which to stay, because I hope God will answer your prayers and I will be able to come to you.

23.verse: Final Greetings - Epaphras, a prisoner with me for Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you.

24.verse: And also Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, workers together with me, send greetings.

25.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
